column4: Anyone have any ideas on my issue so I can please finish the Ubuntu install ?????

I'm in the middle of an install of Dapper and I get to the point where it's trying to install the desktop packages.  In the alt-f4 screen it's saying it can't resolve us.archive.ubuntu.com and many other sites but nothing more is happening.  How can I get past this so I can finish the install using this alternate CD ?
Are you installing using a Live CD?
Why it's trying to access the net I have no idea
Is there a particular reason you're not using the Live CD?  It makes things much easier.
Because I downloaded the alternate CD.  I have no other box to download it too and burn it now
What about the one you're on?  Have you already formatted that box's previous OS?
This box doesn't have a burner
I did the install and had issues getting into KDE due to old configs from Mandriva in my ~/  So I redid the install and formatted /home and now I've been at this same point 3 times
Nevermind, it seemed to just start doing something :)
Aah, okay.  Good luck.  Hehehe.  Come back if you need more help; maybe I'll actually be able to help you then.
Heh thanks.  Seems the system is rebooting now in fact :)
Great.  Look at it this way: This is the equivalent of waiting on hold at Microsoft for them to authorize your XP installation.
And we all know we've all done that a time or 15
